newProperties.name: audit_use_rpc
newProperties.description: Produce audit log messages using internal Redpanda RPCs. When disabled, produce audit log messages using a Kafka client instead.

newProperties.name: cloud_storage_cluster_name
newProperties.description: Optional unique name to disambiguate this cluster's metadata in object storage (e.g. for Whole Cluster Restore) when multiple clusters share a bucket. Must be unique within the bucket, 1-64 chars, [A-Za-z0-9_-]. Do not change once set.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_disable_reconciliation_loop
newProperties.description: Disables the cloud topics reconciliation loop. Disabling the loop can negatively impact performance and stability of the cluster.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_enabled
newProperties.description: Enable cloud topics.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_long_term_garbage_collection_interval
newProperties.description: Time interval after which data is garbage collected from long term storage.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_produce_batching_size_threshold
newProperties.description: The size limit for the object size in cloud topics. When the amount of data on a shard reaches this limit, an upload is triggered.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_produce_cardinality_threshold
newProperties.description: Threshold for the object cardinality in cloud topics. When the number of partitions in waiting for the upload reach this limit, an upload is triggered.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_produce_upload_interval
newProperties.description: Time interval after which the upload is triggered.

newProperties.name: cloud_topics_reconciliation_interval
newProperties.description: Time interval after which data is moved from short term storage to long term storage.

newProperties.name: controller_backend_reconciliation_concurrency
newProperties.description: Maximum concurrent reconciliation operations the controller can run. Higher values can speed up cluster state changes but use more resources.

newProperties.name: enable_shadow_linking
newProperties.description: Enable creating Shadow Links from this cluster to a remote source cluster for data replication.

newProperties.name: iceberg_dlq_table_suffix
newProperties.description: Suffix appended to the Iceberg table name for the dead-letter queue (DLQ) table that stores invalid records when the invalid record action is set to `dlq_table`. Should be chosen in a way that avoids name collisions with other Iceberg tables. Important for catalogs which do not support ~ (tilde) in table names. Should not be changed after any DLQ tables have been created.

newProperties.name: iceberg_rest_catalog_gcp_user_project
newProperties.description: The GCP project that is billed for charges associated with Iceberg REST Catalog requests.

newProperties.name: kafka_max_message_size_upper_limit_bytes
newProperties.description: Maximum allowed value for the `max.message.size` topic property. When set to `null`, then no limit is enforced.

newProperties.name: log_compaction_disable_tx_batch_removal
newProperties.description: Disable removal of transactional control batches. This should only be toggled to `true` in extreme cases of proven instability due to issues with transactional control batch removal.

newProperties.name: log_message_timestamp_after_max_ms
newProperties.description: The maximum allowable timestamp difference between the broker's timestamp and a record's timestamp. For topics with `message.timestamp.type` set to `CreateTime`, Redpanda rejects records that have timestamps later than the broker timestamp and exceed this difference. Redpanda ignores this property for topics with `message.timestamp.type` set to `AppendTime`. The topic property `message.timestamp.after.max.ms` overrides the value of `log_message_timestamp_after_max_ms` at the topic level.

newProperties.name: log_message_timestamp_before_max_ms
newProperties.description: The maximum allowable timestamp difference between the broker's timestamp and a record's timestamp. For topics with `message.timestamp.type` set to `CreateTime`, Redpanda rejects records that have timestamps earlier than the broker timestamp and exceed this difference. Redpanda ignores this property for topics with `message.timestamp.type` set to `AppendTime`. The topic property `message.timestamp.before.max.ms` overrides the value of `log_message_timestamp_before_max_ms` at the topic level.

newProperties.name: message.timestamp.after.max.ms
newProperties.description: No description

newProperties.name: message.timestamp.before.max.ms
newProperties.description: No description

newProperties.name: tls_v1_2_cipher_suites
newProperties.description: Specifies the TLS 1.2 cipher suites available for external client connections as a colon-separated OpenSSL-compatible list. Configure this property to support legacy clients.

newProperties.name: tls_v1_3_cipher_suites
newProperties.description: Specifies the TLS 1.3 cipher suites available for external client connections as a colon-separated OpenSSL-compatible list. Most deployments don't need to modify this setting. Configure this property only for specific organizational security policies.

changedDescriptions.name: consumer_group_lag_collection_interval
changedDescriptions.oldDescription: How often to run the collection loop when enable_consumer_group_metrics contains consumer_lag
changedDescriptions.newDescription: How often Redpanda runs the collection loop when `enable_consumer_group_metrics` is set to `consumer_lag`. Updates will not be more frequent than `health_monitor_max_metadata_age`.

changedDescriptions.name: transactional_id_expiration_ms
changedDescriptions.oldDescription: Expiration time of producer IDs. Measured starting from the time of the last write until now for a given ID.
changedDescriptions.newDescription: Expiration time of producer IDs. Measured starting from the time of the last write until now for a given ID. Producer IDs are automatically removed from memory when they expire, which helps manage memory usage. However, this natural cleanup may not be sufficient for workloads with high producer churn rates. For applications with long-running transactions, ensure this value accommodates your typical transaction lifetime to avoid premature producer ID expiration.
